result.execSummary:
The defendant Orland D. Dagan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orland D. Dagan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orland D. Dagan was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence the deft is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $300.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  May Not have contac with Brian M, his residence or place of employment.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Valerie Karls.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:23am-  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 4 years: 2 years initial confinement & 2 years extended supervision w/ conditions - consecutive to any sentence the DE is currently serving.  Credit for 30 days.  Court orders a $300.00 fine plus costs & DNA surcharge.  DE stipulates to restitution.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $160.70.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.

SWE filed on 9-4-14  KPD Case No. 14-125471
transferred from 14GF4103x
from Mary Barnes    (Copy sent to DA's Office & Attorney Karls on 3/20/2015)
from Vanessa Hayward
For Restitution Filed by ADA J Zapf.

Defendant Orland D. Dagan appeared with Attorney Valerie Stuart Karls.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1: Burglary, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Defendant admits to prior convictions. Cts 2-4 dismissed on ST's motion.   Presentence Investigation ordered. Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Valerie Stuart Karls appeared.  Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution. Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE was sent to prison, DA's office to prepare a writ for the next hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Valerie Karls.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:34am-  Matter heard with 14CF1051.  Victim rights compliance.  Attorney Karls is requesting an adjournment to discuss videos obtained in discovery w/ the DE.  Court grants request.  Final pre-trial adjourned to February 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE. KPD Det. Peter Falk sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Karls. Probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3 for arraignment on 10-15-14 @ 1:30pm.  Information filed. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing moved from 9-23 to 9-18-14 @ 9:45am with def.'s other case 14CF1051. DA's Office and Atty. Karls notified.

156pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Val Karls.  Clerk: LE  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 9/23/14 @ 830am.  Atty. Karls moves to dismiss Cts.3 & 4.  Court grants motion.  Cts.3 & 4 dismissed.  $1000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
